expands.title: UI/UX Designer
expands.content:
I have a good eye for design, many have said. Usually I just rip stuff from [Sketch Repo](https://sketchrepo.com/) and then mold it to my needs using, as you might imagine, [Sketch](https://www.sketch.com/). But sometimes I design stuff from scratch. Whatever works.

And as for UX: back during my DealCatcher days I read literally every single [Nielsen Norman Group](https://www.nngroup.com/) blog post. So consider me qualified ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Current projects of mine (that I designed and developed) are [Remote Faces](https://remotefaces.com), [Radically Marginal](https://radicallymarginal.com), and [Practicar](https://practicar.mx).

Additionally, here are some screenshots from websites I‚Äôve made over the years. All but one is - or was at one point - an actual live website‚Ä¶. not just a mockup.

![](img/designs/showuply-4-browser.jpg)

![](img/designs/showuply-2-browser.png)

![](img/designs/showuply-browser.png)

[I‚Äôve been an all-or-nothing person most of my life. It‚Äôs mostly gone away in the past couple of years, as I‚Äôve figured out who I am and what I want (not an easy task). But prior to that, I would make grand plans and have trouble following through. So I made this community to help people like me (there are a bunch of us) not quit when things got boring, or when we were feeling like imposters, or whatevs.](/img/designs/showuply.JPG)

![](img/designs/feedhero-browser.png)

[I made this pretty sophisticated Twitter Relationship Manager tool to seriously encourage authentic Twitter relationships. And I got about 35 people to pay for it and use it. But over time, I (and many of my users) started to realize that the best way to have authentic relationships was actually to skip Twitter altogether.](/img/designs/feedhero.png)

![](img/designs/safecars-browser.png)

[My (now ex) wife got in a bad car accident, and when she went to get a new car we couldn‚Äôt find a single service that let you search for used cars by safety AND price at the same time. So I compiled the data from a few different sources and made the site myself. We went with a 2009 Subaru Forester FWIW.](/img/designs/safecars.png)

![](img/designs/noncents-1-browser.jpg)

![](img/designs/noncents-2-browser.png)

[I got into this crypto phase for‚Ä¶ about two months‚Ä¶ and then I realized that I didn‚Äôt care at all, so this website went bye bye.](/img/designs/noncents-2.png)

![](img/designs/justfreakingpublish-browser.jpg)

[I quite like accountability tools/communties/ideas. Discipline is overrated.](/img/designs/justfreakingpublish.jpg)

![](img/designs/commute-guardian-browser.jpg)

[Made at and for Luxonis. This one is still publicly live.](/img/designs/commute-guardian.jpg)

![](img/designs/beeminder-browser.jpg)

[A mockup I made for my friends at Beeminder. Because I really love their product but could never get past the 1990s web design. This is the only of these design screenshots that was snapped from Sketch‚Ä¶ all the rest were taken from live websites (though most on my local server).](/img/designs/beeminder.jpg)

expands.title: Full-Stack Developer
expands.content:
My go-to stack these days is [Nuxt.js](https://nuxtjs.org/) + [Tailwind](tailwindcss.com/) + [NetlifyCMS](https://www.netlifycms.org/) on the frontend, all hosted on [Netlify](https://www.netlify.com/). And then either [Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/) - or [Lumen](https://lumen.laravel.com/) + MySQL - for the backend, depending on the project.

I made [this 4.7-star iOS App](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/dealcatcher-coupons-deals-shopping-app/id534634276), [this Rails site](https://www.dealcatcher.com/), [this custom-MVC site](https://www.pickmonitor.com/), [this Vue site](https://luxonis.com/), and too many [Laravel](https://laravel.com/) sites to count.

I‚Äôve worked with [Jekyll](https://jekyllrb.com/), [Flutter](https://flutter.dev/), [WordPress](https://wordpress.org/), and [Shopify](https://shopify.com). I‚Äôve installed beautiful [Flarum](https://flarum.org) forums like [this one](https://discuss.luxonis.com). I, of course, speak the much-hated [jQuery](https://jquery.com/) (but haven‚Äôt used it in some time). I‚Äôve done brief C and C++ firmware development.

I use postman, composer, and npm, and scss, and probably whatever else you use.

Do I have X years of experience with Y specific framework? I don‚Äôt know. Probably not. But if you‚Äôre judging a candidate based on whether they have experience with Vue versus whether they have experience with React‚Ä¶ I not-so-humbly think you‚Äôre doing it wrong.

[Oh, and also, I do things the right way, for the right reasons. My code is clean AF, and the things I make are crisp AF. As just one silly example, here‚Äôs the Page Speed for this site on my very first check, before a single optimization. Swear to Zeus.](/img/shots/speed.png)

expands.title: Machine Learning Engineer
expands.content:
I spent the majority of my time at [Luxonis](https://luxonis.com) doing Machine Learning Engineering and Computer Vision work. Sadly the bulk of that work was done under NDA for a third party, so I can't really talk about what I did (which is pretty freaking cool, actually) or share any results.

But I can talk in broad strokes.

Essentially I got very good at object tracking and detection, semantic segmentation, and absurd debugging.

I also learned how to do lots of completely useless things like:

![](img/shots/useless-ml-contour.jpg)

[A photo from outside the Prague hostel I volunteered at in Aug 2018. Using my mad Machine Learning skills to turn it into this very very definitely useful contour drawing.](/img/shots/useless-ml-contour.jpg)

![](img/shots/probably-a-person.png)

[Or look how I can show disbelievers that yes, I am in fact 91% likely to be a person!](/img/shots/probably-a-person.png)

![](img/shots/video-game-patrick.jpeg)

[I can also pretend to be the superstar of Ultime Friz, the video game.](/img/shots/video-game-patrick.jpeg)

expands.title: Search Engine Optimizer
expands.content: I spent an entire year of my life, whilst [here](https://dealcatcher.com/), doing nothing but optimizing internet stuff for The Googs. I would not recommend others follow in my footsteps.

title: Skills & Experience
intro:
My soft skills are by far my biggest strength. My empathy and vulnerability. My communication and interpersonal skills. My curiosity and ingenuity. My smile. My insufferable energy. My insatiable desire to get my feet wet and my hands dirty.

(Apparently modesty is not one of my soft skills ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è)

As far as hard skills...

As I mentioned above, I'm not a coder. In fact, I don't even *like* coding. I find it horribly boring, lonely, and a little bit depressing.

Nor am I a designer or a marketer.

I'm a problem-solving human being who happens to know how to code, how to design, and how to market.

To the right business, this distinction will make all the difference. Because whether I speak React or Vue or Angular is missing the point. It's meaningless fluff.

Put a problem on my desk and I'll figure it out.

That said, here's a rundown of the various roles that I've held in my 12 years of professional experience.
outro: Why so many different roles? Because I've only ever worked at tiny companies. Tiny companies don't have the luxury of specificity, so my teams were often asked "would anybody be willing to take a shot at X?" I was - and will continue to be - the first person to raise his hand.
